channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Facing Israeli Assault, Many in Gaza City Say Fleeing Again Is Worse
item.description: Israel has ordered hundreds of thousands of people to evacuate the city and go to the southern Gaza Strip, but many residents say it is no safer for t...

item.title: Las Vegas mayor says the city is suffering from a serious drop in Canadian tourists: ‘We need you, and we miss you’
item.description: Shelley Berkley echoed worries from last month when she said traffic from Canada and Mexico has "gone from a faucet to a drip."

item.title: NATO Says It Scrambled Fighter Jets to Shoot Down Russian Drones Over Poland
item.description: The incursion was the first time alliance planes had engaged enemy targets in NATO airspace. Poland’s leader called it “a large-scale provocation.”

item.title: Republicans Race to Advance Stephen Miran, Trump’s Fed Pick, Despite White House Ties

item.title: Jamie Dimon says economy is ‘weakening’ but he can’t make sense of all the different data: ‘Maybe, one day, AI will fix that problem’

item.title: For OpenAI’s chief revenue officer, research chops rather than ‘big marketing efforts’ is the key to winning customers
item.description: At Fortune Brainstorm Tech, OpenAI chief revenue officer Ashley Kramer says keeping rivals at bay will take more than flashy marketing

item.title: Here are the main features you’re sacrificing if you buy Apple’s new ultra-thin iPhone Air
item.description: It's the boldest iPhone design in years. But it doesn't come without some compromises.

item.title: New Yorkers Support Free Buses, but They Don’t Think It Should Happen
item.description: A polling experiment shows how a small change in wording can make a big difference.
